title: East Suffolk Line Walks

images.title: michael wade / Round pond, Christchurch Park
images.caption: Round pond, Christchurch Park. Large pond within the main town park in Ipswich.

images.title: Andrew Hill / Tuddenham St Martin from the bridge
images.caption: Tuddenham St Martin village from the bridge. A typical village scene with the church on the hill. Just east of Ipswich near the start of the walk.

images.title: Bob Jones / Saltmarsh and the River Deben
images.caption: Saltmarsh and the River Deben near Woodbridge. Near Kyson Point the remaining saltmarsh is intersected by various tributaries of the river. The saltmarsh is disappearing rapidly from East Anglia's tidal rivers.

images.title: TREVOR NORRIS / Wilford Bridge Melton
images.caption: Wilford Bridge Melton. Taken from the river bank at Melton which is the end to navigational water on the River Deben.

images.title: Looking from the river path from Holton to Halesworth towards the railway line by Basher Eyre, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Looking from the river path from Holton to Halesworth towards the railway line

images.title: Beccles Carnival by Ashley Dace, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Beccles Carnival

images.title: Oulton Broad Swingbridge by Ashley Dace, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Oulton Broad Swingbridge

images.title: The beach at Lowestoft by Steve Daniels, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The beach at Lowestoft

description: Follow the 'East Suffolk Line' railway from Ipswich to Lowestoft on this splendid walk through the Suffolk countryside. You'll pass through Woodbridge, Melton, Saxmundham, Halesworth and Beccles. There are also several riverside sections along the Rivers Alde, Deben, Fynn and the final one along the River Waveney from Beccles to Lowesoft. The walk is waymarked with a yellow and blue disc.
